description: Phase that enables an operator to check out equipment required by the Bill of Equipment (BOE) for use in the manufacturing process, validating status and updating allocation.
intent: To verify equipment status, allocate equipment to the unit procedure, and record the check-out before process steps proceed.

inputs.Instructions: Instruction text displayed to the operator at runtime.
inputs.EquipmentClassList: List of Equipment Classes marked as 'Allowed Checkout' with their status types, descriptions, and expected values.
inputs.EquipmentIDInput: Textbox input for scanning or entering an equipment ID (simple method).
inputs.SelectedEquipmentRow: Grid selection of an equipment class when using the guided method.
inputs.CheckOutAction: Button event to execute the check-out of the selected or entered equipment.
inputs.ShowCheckedInToggle: Toggle to filter and display only checked-in equipment in the list.
inputs.ConfirmationType: Signature/confirmation level required when finishing the phase.

outputs.CheckedOutEquipment: List of equipment IDs that were successfully checked out and their updated statuses.
outputs.ExceptionsRecorded: Details of any status-override exceptions recorded during check-out.

conditions: Phase is invoked from the Action List
Equipment classes have been marked 'Allowed Checkout' during authoring
ALLOW_EQUIPQC_OVERRIDE parameter controls whether the operator can override status checks

preconditions: Recipe author has added a Check Out Equipment phase and configured runtime instructions and BOE equipment classes.
Equipment items are registered in the system and available for check-out.
postconditions: Selected equipment items are marked as Pending Check Out and allocated to the unit procedure.
Equipment statuses are updated (e.g., set to 'Pending Check out').
side_effects: May call the Exception page if an equipment fails its status check and an override is requested.
Operator may navigate to Equipment Maintenance or Equipment Log report pages for further actions or information.
example_usage: Author configures a Check Out Equipment phase with instructions 'Check out required equipment', selects classes Mixer and Dryer. At runtime, the operator selects the Mixer class, scans equipment ID 'MX-1001', clicks [Check Out], handles an override exception, then clicks [Finish] and signs off to complete the check-out.
